docs.abstract: Collecting cards is no longer child’s play; it’s a big-money realm of affluent collectors with an eye on returns.
docs.snippet: Collecting cards is no longer child’s play; it’s a big-money realm of affluent collectors with an eye on returns.
docs.lead_paragraph: Brady Hill used his skills for buying and selling baseball cards to purchase his first car and to pay his way through Louisiana State University.

headline.main: Trading Cards: A Hobby That Became a Multimillion-Dollar Investment
headline.print_headline: Some Traders Study Stock Prices. Others Monitor the ’52 Mantle.

docs.abstract: The video streaming company said that it would ban videos promoting the sale or manufacture of firearms and their accessories.
docs.snippet: The video streaming company said that it would ban videos promoting the sale or manufacture of firearms and their accessories.
docs.lead_paragraph: YouTube said this week that it would tighten restrictions on some firearm videos, its latest policy announcement since coming under scrutiny after last month’s mass shooting at a high school in Parkland, Fla.

headline.main: YouTube to Ban Videos Promoting Gun Sales
headline.print_headline: YouTube to Ban Videos That Promote The Construction or Sale of Firearms

docs.abstract: The proposal is meant to help allay British regulators’ concerns that full control of Sky would give Mr. Murdoch too much power over the country’s media.
docs.snippet: The proposal is meant to help allay British regulators’ concerns that full control of Sky would give Mr. Murdoch too much power over the country’s media.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The Walt Disney Company offered to buy Sky News on Tuesday — but not because the British news channel is core to Disney’s business.

headline.main: Disney Offers to Buy Sky News to Aid Rupert Murdoch’s Bid for Sky

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

docs.abstract: In their annual update for the Gates Foundation, they say that they remain optimistic about the world’s progress, but that President Trump’s policies could hurt their efforts.
docs.snippet: In their annual update for the Gates Foundation, they say that they remain optimistic about the world’s progress, but that President Trump’s policies could hurt their efforts.
docs.lead_paragraph: KIRKLAND, Wash. — For the past year, Bill and Melinda Gates have received the same question repeatedly while jetting around the world: How is President Trump affecting their work as two of the world’s top philanthropists?

headline.main: Bill and Melinda Gates Tackle ‘Tough Questions’ and Trump
headline.print_headline: Gateses Field Questions About Tough Topics  And Trump’s Policies

docs.abstract: The scandal over how Facebook let a consulting firm gain access to user information is ushering in a new era for privacy experts, whose warnings about online privacy have long gone unheeded.
docs.snippet: The scandal over how Facebook let a consulting firm gain access to user information is ushering in a new era for privacy experts, whose warnings about online privacy have long gone unheeded.
docs.lead_paragraph: PALO ALTO, Calif. — Doc Searls met with a group of fellow internet privacy experts one recent afternoon here at the Computer History Museum. On a whiteboard were the words “OUTRAGE” and “MAKE HAY” — capitalized, underlined and surrounded by lines jutting in all directions like a cartoon “BOOM!”

headline.main: After Cambridge Analytica, Privacy Experts Get to Say ‘I Told You So’
headline.print_headline: Privacy Issue Rises to Fore, Vindicating Data Experts

docs.abstract: The historian Niall Ferguson’s new book goes a long way toward redressing the lack of perspective to a concept central to the technological “revolution”: networks.
docs.snippet: The historian Niall Ferguson’s new book goes a long way toward redressing the lack of perspective to a concept central to the technological “revolution”: networks.
docs.lead_paragraph: It is indisputable that the internet — facilitated by both vast improvements in access and computing power — has had a disruptive impact on not just business but politics and many aspects of our daily lives. Demonstrating precisely what that impact is, however, has been remarkably challenging. Pronouncements on the topic have a tendency to be overblown. “Transformational,” “exponential” and “revolutionary” are increasingly favored adjectives, whether they are applicable or not.

headline.main: Review: Even on the Internet, What’s Old Is New Again

docs.abstract: In her new book, Professor Priya Satia aims to overturn the conventional wisdom about the role of guns in the world’s economic development.
docs.snippet: In her new book, Professor Priya Satia aims to overturn the conventional wisdom about the role of guns in the world’s economic development.
docs.lead_paragraph: Adam Smith, in his classic “The Wealth of Nations,” was an early proponent of the now mainstream view that wars are unfortunate accidents that have “crowded out” more productive investments.

headline.main: Review: ‘Empire of Guns’ Challenges the Role of War in Industrialization

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: Empire of Guns: The Violent Making of the Industrial Revolution (Book)

docs.abstract: As big airlines face a wave of retirements, a fresh batch of fliers gets a chance, and the training, to seize the opportunity.
docs.snippet: As big airlines face a wave of retirements, a fresh batch of fliers gets a chance, and the training, to seize the opportunity.
docs.lead_paragraph: Michelle Hynds was working at a security job seven years ago when she began to take flight lessons at an airport near Ventura, Calif.

headline.main: More Jobs Will Be Cleared for Takeoff. Aspiring Pilots Are Ready.
headline.print_headline: Job Seekers’ Market For Aspiring Pilots

byline.original: By Zach Wichter and Micah Maidenberg

docs.abstract: High-speed broadband is plentiful in most cities, but for those out in the country with only metered cellular connections, every megabyte counts.
docs.snippet: High-speed broadband is plentiful in most cities, but for those out in the country with only metered cellular connections, every megabyte counts.
docs.lead_paragraph: Q. Some of us in the boonies must rely entirely on cellular Wi-Fi hot spots. As a result, data usage is a very important consideration, as each gigabyte must be paid for. Fortunately, we have 4G speed, but how much data do services like Instagram or Spotify use? How can one tell how much a YouTube video will consume? Obviously, one can go to a free Wi-Fi locale to see some content, but there are the security issues.

headline.main: Measuring and Managing Your Cellular Data Use
headline.print_headline: Measuring Your Use of Cellular Data

docs.abstract: The move to get rid of the man the Weinsteins called their “third brother” comes at an urgent moment for the troubled company.
docs.snippet: The move to get rid of the man the Weinsteins called their “third brother” comes at an urgent moment for the troubled company.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Weinstein Company’s board of directors announced Friday night that they had unanimously voted to fire the company’s president and chief operating officer, David Glasser, for cause.

headline.main: Weinstein Company Fires David Glasser, Its President
headline.print_headline: Weinstein Company Fires President at Crucial Time
